New Records: Shohei Ohtani suffered a partial dislocation of his left shoulder during the game.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto had a commanding performance across 6.1 innings, allowing just one hit and recording four strikeouts.
Key Match Events: Teoscar Hernandez and Freddie Freeman hit back-to-back home runs in the bottom of the third inning.
Alex Vesia threw one pitch to seal the Dodgers' 4-2 win.
Pre-Game Insights: Ice Cube performed ahead of the game's start, pumping up the crowd with classic songs.
The Dodgers had a display honoring Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam from Game 1.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts provided a positive update on Shohei Ohtani's injury.
The Yankees struggled at the plate for eight of the nine innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The World Series format was explained, with the Dodgers hosting Games 1 and 2.
The starting lineups for both teams were announced before the game.
